name: inveterately
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows a lack of willingness or ability to change, or to stop doing something: Throughout his life he gambled inveterately on horses. Both women were inveterately flirtatious.
More examplesFewer examplesHe found them inveterately hostile, despite all his attempts to conciliate them.On the top is a wooden tunnel, which the inveterately curious animals cannot resist entering.I have been inveterately loyal and willing to take grave risks which could even lead to the end of my career.
